markdown:
# üåÖ AI Daily Digest ‚Äî 2026-02-11

---

## üß† MODEL

‚Ä¢ **GPT-5.2 now powers ChatGPT Deep Research** ‚Äî @OpenAI  
OpenAI quietly upgraded its deep research feature to GPT-5.2, marking the first public deployment of the 5.x series. Expect improved reasoning and source synthesis for complex queries. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/OpenAI/status/2021299935678026168)

‚Ä¢ **Claude Opus 4.6 Fast Mode delivers 2.5x speed** ‚Äî @adocomplete  
Anthropic's latest optimization lets developers trade nothing for speed‚Äîsame model, same capabilities, just faster inference. Useful for latency-sensitive agentic workflows. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/adocomplete/status/2021296551864459568)

‚Ä¢ **Nemotron ColEmbed V2 tops ViDoRe V3 multimodal retrieval** ‚Äî HuggingFace Blog  
NVIDIA's new embedding model claims the top spot on the ViDoRe V3 benchmark for multimodal document retrieval. Strong signal for RAG pipelines handling mixed text/image content. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/nvidia/nemotron-colembed-v2)

‚Ä¢ **H Company's Holo2-235B leads UI Localization benchmarks** ‚Äî HuggingFace Blog  
A 235B parameter model with 22B active (MoE architecture) specifically optimized for understanding and localizing user interfaces. Interesting niche play. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/Hcompany/introducing-holo2-235b-a22b)

---

## üì± APP

‚Ä¢ **Cowork launches on Windows with full feature parity** ‚Äî @claudeai  
Anthropic's agentic desktop app now runs on Windows with file access, multi-step execution, plugins, and MCP connectors. No more Mac-only complaints. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/claudeai/status/2021336313979625910)

‚Ä¢ **OpenAI Responses API adds primitives for long-running agents** ‚Äî @OpenAIDevs  
New server-side compaction enables multi-hour agent runs without context limits. Containers now get controlled internet access. This is infrastructure for serious autonomous work. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/2021286050623373500)

‚Ä¢ **Google's Natively Adaptive Interfaces framework** ‚Äî Google AI Blog  
A new accessibility framework using AI to make interfaces adapt to individual user needs in real-time. Promising direction for inclusive design at the OS level. [Read more ‚Üí](https://blog.google/company-news/outreach-and-initiatives/accessibility/natively-adaptive-interfaces-ai-accessibility/)

---

## üîß DEV

‚Ä¢ **Transformers.js v4 Preview now on NPM** ‚Äî HuggingFace Blog  
The JavaScript ML library gets a major update. Run transformer models directly in the browser or Node.js with improved performance and broader model support. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/transformersjs-v4)

‚Ä¢ **Draw.io releases official MCP server** ‚Äî @drawio (3,919 likes)  
Diagram tool now integrates with Claude and other MCP-compatible agents. Also ships browser-based instructions for those who don't want to run a server. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/drawio/status/2020918870375370825)

‚Ä¢ **SyGra Studio from ServiceNow** ‚Äî HuggingFace Blog  
New tool for building and deploying synthetic data generation pipelines. Enterprise focus, but the underlying techniques are broadly applicable. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/ServiceNow-AI/sygra-studio)

‚Ä¢ **Community Evals: Crowdsourced model benchmarking** ‚Äî HuggingFace Blog  
HuggingFace's response to opaque leaderboards‚Äîlet the community define and run evaluations. Transparency over marketing. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/community-evals)

---

## üìù TECHNIQUE

‚Ä¢ **UI/UX architect prompt with Jobs/Ive design philosophy** ‚Äî @kloss_xyz (5,119 likes)  
A detailed system prompt that turns coding agents into design auditors, reviewing screens component-by-component and generating phased improvement plans. Worth stealing for product work. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/kloss_xyz/status/2018869093789728799)

‚Ä¢ **Bypassing permission prompts in Cowork's code mode** ‚Äî @felixrieseberg  
For power users who trust their agents: a new "danger mode" setting. The warning is explicit‚Äîdon't blame the tool when it deletes your branches. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/felixrieseberg/status/2021076965525159998)

‚Ä¢ **MCP server creation tutorial in 18 minutes** ‚Äî @aaditsh (1,159 likes)  
Practical walkthrough of building an MCP server with Claude Code. Good entry point for developers wanting to extend agent capabilities. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/aaditsh/status/1921226473471676499)

---

## üöÄ PRODUCT

‚Ä¢ **Entire.io: Ex-GitHub CEO's new developer platform for AI agents** ‚Äî Hacker News (303 points, 268 comments)  
Nat Friedman launches a platform specifically designed for AI agent development workflows. Early details sparse but the pedigree commands attention. [Read more ‚Üí](https://entire.io/blog/hello-entire-world/)

‚Ä¢ **Mistral AI announces $200K hackathon across 8 cities** ‚Äî @MistralAI  
Feb 28‚ÄìMar 1 in Paris, London, NYC, SF, Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, and online. Partners include Weights & Biases, NVIDIA, AWS. Largest Mistral community event yet. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/MistralAI/status/2021238361227186462)

‚Ä¢ **Rowboat: Open-source AI coworker with knowledge graphs** ‚Äî Hacker News (105 points, 27 comments)  
Turns your work into a queryable knowledge graph. Show HN project worth watching for personal knowledge management use cases. [Read more ‚Üí](https://github.com/rowboatlabs/rowboat)

‚Ä¢ **Oxide raises $200M Series C** ‚Äî Hacker News (507 points, 266 comments)  
The on-prem cloud hardware company continues its mission to bring hyperscaler infrastructure to enterprises. Not AI-native, but increasingly relevant as companies seek to run models locally. [Read more ‚Üí](https://oxide.computer/blog/our-200m-series-c)

---

## üéì MODEL LITERACY

**What is "server-side compaction"?**  
When AI agents run for extended periods, their conversation history grows until it exceeds the model's context window‚Äîthe maximum amount of text it can process at once. Server-side compaction automatically summarizes older parts of the conversation, preserving essential information while freeing up space for new context. This lets agents maintain coherent multi-hour sessions without losing track of what they're doing, a critical capability for autonomous coding and research tasks.

---

## üéØ PICK OF THE DAY

**OpenAI's Responses API primitives for long-running agents**

This is infrastructure, not a flashy demo‚Äîand that's why it matters. Server-side compaction and networked containers solve two of the hardest problems in deploying real autonomous agents: context limits and internet access. Combined with GPT-5.2 in deep research, OpenAI is clearly building toward agents that can work independently for hours. The agentic future just got more concrete.

[Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/2021286050623373500)
